title: Marcelo Ortiz M.
text:
I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Economics and Business at Universitat Pompeu Fabra.
My research interests lie at the intersection of Accounting and Corporate Governance. I have two research agendas. The first one is on the role of corporate information (legal disclosures and leaks) on markets and corporate policies. The second one is on the role of the family behind the family firms, with special focus on their internal decision making and external interactions with other stakeholders and political actors.

Link to my CV.
I co-organize the Barcelona Accounting Summer Seminars and Workshops.
Also, I am an Affiliated Professor at the Barcelona School of Economics and UPF-Barcelona School of Management.

title: About
text:
I grew up in Chile, between Viña del Mar and Santiago.
I studied for all my degrees at Universidad Adolfo Ibañez, first industrial engineering (undergraduate) and financial engineering (MSc), and then a PhD in Finance. When not studying, I spent most of my weekends on the beach, lakes, rivers and montains. I like water sports, hiking, and photography. See some of my pictures from Chile below!
I moved to the Netherlands in 2018 as a visiting PhD student at Erasmus University. In 2019, I started working at Universitat Pompeu Fabra.
Before starting my PhD, I worked as a financial trader for five years, handling interest and liquidity risk exposure in Itau Bank (formerly “Corpbanca”).
